messages.title: Vote Labour for a better Adur and Worthing
messages.content: Tim Macpherson writes: 'The dead hand of a Southern Tory hegroup homica is not serving the people of the district with their tactic of restrict and keep prices high.' A new strategy on employment planning and housing development is the issue in getting Worthing back to work.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Introduce strict controls of the private rental sector to give tenants proper protection.
25 hours free childcare for 3 & 4 year olds with working parents.
Minimum wage to £8 an hour over the next five years when Ed Miliband becomes Prime Minister.
Labour announces plans for 8,000 more GPs and 20,000 more nurses to build an NHS with the Time to Care Fund.

issues.economy: Labour will raise the minimum wage to £8 an hour over the next five years.
issues.health: Labour announces plans for 8,000 more GPs and 20,000 more nurses to build an NHS with the Time to Care Fund.

housing.content: A new strategy on employment planning and housing development is the issue in getting Worthing back to work.

leaflet.personalStatement: Everyone I speak to is worried about the NHS and the future of local hospital services - rightly so.

quotes.text: Labour will raise the minimum wage to £8 an hour over the next five years - a fair deal - a fair deal - a fair deal.

images.caption: Tim Macpherson, Your Labour Candidate for East Worthing and Shoreham
